intro: Ischaemum hirtum, commonly known as hairy milletgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as fields and roadsides. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brown flowers. Its seeds are small and wind-dispersed, contributing to its ability to colonize disturbed areas. Ischaemum hirtum is often found in temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North America.
